title: Plotly R Open Source Graphing Library
description: Plotly's R graphing library makes interactive, publication-quality graphs. Examples of how to make line plots, scatter plots, area charts, bar charts, error bars, box plots, histograms, heatmaps, subplots, multiple-axes, and 3D (WebGL based) charts.

title: Welcome to R.journey From Zero To Hero
description: This personal project isn‚Äôt something revolutionary nor is it something that has never been done before; it‚Äôs simply a testament to the importance of having a solid purpose when venturing into an unknown domain that will present you with challenges you aren‚Äôt used to facing.
contents:
R.journey From Zero To Hero

There are very few (if any) fields today that aren‚Äôt impacted in
some way, shape or form by programming. Programming is a term that‚Äôs
basically synonymous with technology and what professional field today
doesn‚Äôt employ some form of technology? The ability to code has become
one of those skills that open up an incredible number of doors if you
possess it and it‚Äôs this fact that led me to venture into the world of
R‚Äì one of many programming languages‚Äì to simply explore it and see what
I could learn. I wanted to write this article not to convince people to
pick up coding as a skill (although it‚Äôs great) but more as a
documentation of my journey in learning a new skill and how important
having an actual purpose for something like this can be, however small
or niche.
I officially started this journey just over a year ago and it‚Äôs
important to note that I didn‚Äôt really start it with any specific goal
in mind nor did I have any real notion of where I could apply this
skill. In short, I had no purpose. Now, this wasn‚Äôt a problem initially
because I guess you could say my purpose was just to learn the language
but even that in itself is incredibly vague and doesn‚Äôt provide a clear
enough end point.
In 2022 I found the best course ‚Äúfrom-Zero-to-hero-in-r‚Äù By Jeelaidm
This is a course designed by Batool Almarzouq and delivered in
JeelAIDM
Week1: Introduction to R and RStudio
Week2: Introduction to Git/GitHub
Week3: First steps in the
tidyverse
Week4: Introduction to ggplot2
Week5: Publishing R Markdown and Creating a blog with R
Markdown
Learn How to Join with R Communities (R-Ladies, Open Science
Community Saudi Arabia, R-Ladies Saudi Arabia (Dammam)

It has been a long journey but it made my summer much more
interesting. üíï
Learned a lot and enjoyed every single minute. üíü Never Stop learning
with JeelAIDM

throughout the course‚Ä¶ I really loved it‚ô•Ô∏è
Looking forward to learn more from you‚Ä¶üíü
Thanks ALL for this wonderful opportunity üôå
